intro: Binghamia cajamarquilla, commonly known as the Andean flame tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Peru. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Binghamia cajamarquilla thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it an important species in Andean biodiversity.
